content:
is there a computable form of the canonicalization that are used for Digital Signatures?

This canonicalization method is identified by the URI http://hl7.org/fhir/canonicalization/xml. The following additional canonicalization URIs are also defined:

I was thinking that there was, but can't find it.

Signature datatype http://build.fhir.org/datatypes.html#signature
Found in Provenance.signature and Bundle.signature

that does explain it, as does the pages from there. But they explain it in human readable terms.. but none of them carry a computable form. I was expecting, especially in XML, there would be some computable form.
